column1: Shop locally this Saturday and the rest of this holiday season. Knowing you’re directly supporting a neighbor makes buying that gift all the more special. Read my article about shopping locally here: https://t.co/pjbTgGX1VL https://t.co/Xcl7Yru0ic
Happy Thanksgiving! Diana and I send our best wishes to families across Wyoming and those who are not able to spend the holiday with family. Give thanks and stay safe. https://t.co/AX5J9jV9WB
We will always cherish our time with the Marshall Legacy Institute. Watch our history with land mine protection here (Start at 44:00 minutes): https://t.co/AZ6s9Obu9i

Diana created CHAMPS (Children Against Land Mine Program). Students donated quarters for a land mine detection dog named Wyoming to save lives in Sri Lanka. Kids learned that you can make a difference with a quarter but in someone else’s life it was THE difference in their life. https://t.co/DQquhTpdDo

Thank you to @MarshallLegacy for honoring us with the 2020 Founder’s Award. More than 20 years ago Diana and I became involved with the Marshall Legacy Institute with a goal to help clear dangerous land mines. This program has saved lives of humans and animals across the world. https://t.co/BklkKFBtEU

Wyoming has more than 1000 kids currently in our foster care system waiting for a home. Today is National Adoption Day and we celebrate families who welcomed a new member into their homes and raise awareness for those who are interested in one day growing their family. https://t.co/5GAdMTvsbn

A new proposed rule would protect American values by ensuring banks are not denying critical services to entire sectors of our economy. I’m glad all industries will have a fair shot without being prejudicially denied service. https://t.co/gERlnfRORq
I would encourage people to listen to the doctors’ testimonies. You can watch the full hearing here: https://t.co/kznrAH9Y6X

When it comes to COVID-19 treatments people aren’t looking for next year’s answer they’re looking for this year’s answer. I appreciate hearing from health officials about the benefits of other early treatments for patients until a vaccine is available. https://t.co/m9wpbJ3hOx

I'm pleased F.E. Warren will be one of the newest homes to the more modern MH-139 Grey Wolf helicopter. These helicopters are faster more advanced aircrafts and will help ensure our Air Force can successfully carry out missions and keep our country safe. https://t.co/JGNq9WiAoI

Wyoming is the proud home to C-130 planes and delivers help all over the world. It’s vital we don’t trade our already capable and experienced fleets for a more expensive and less defined option. https://t.co/oLE970XQ2l

The Air National Guard C-130 aircraft fleet provides nearly half of the Air Force’s air transportation for operations. I joined my colleagues in urging the Armed Services Committee to ensure funding in the defense spending bill to maintain an adequate inventory of C-130 aircraft.

I encourage veterans to preserve their stories by contributing to the Veterans History Project where their contributions will forever be part of our history in the Library of Congress! https://t.co/HRTk5YTJCv

Thank you to our nation’s veterans for your service and sacrifice – you are America’s heroes. Wyoming is home to more than 45000 veterans and they continue to be important leaders and voices within our state. https://t.co/k2cdpn1mwv
I only have a few weeks left as a U.S. Senator but I remain a proud American citizen and I look forward to helping serve my country in other ways as I enter this new chapter of my life.

If my experience over the years has taught me anything it is that we will never be able to tackle these challenges unless we find common areas of agreement first and work to solve those problems together.
As we move forward our country has no shortage of problems we need to address. Some are out of our control but many are of our own making.
Our county commissioners city council school board members – those are the people who shape our communities and I applaud everyone who had the courage to put their name on a ballot this year.
There’s a lot of interest and attention focused on the top of the ballot and rightly so but it’s important to remember that governing happens at the local level.
I also want to congratulate @RepLizCheney on her re-election to the House of Representatives. Along with @SenJohnBarrasso our state will have a powerful trio serving us in Congress.

Congratulations to Senator-elect @CynthiaMLummis on being elected to fill the seat I have had the honor to hold for 24 years. I know she will put Wyoming first and be a force to be reckoned with in Washington.

It’s important to remember that the purpose of the Endangered Species Act is to get to this point where a species is fully recovered. I am hopeful that even more species in the future will be able to reach this milestone.

Today @Interior announced a rule to delist the gray wolf from the ESA list in the lower 48 states. This has been a long and bumpy road but I think everyone should take pride in this announcement today. States like WY have shown they are able to effectively manage the gray wolf.

Congratulations to the newest addition to the U.S. Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett. From scholar to judge and now justice she exemplifies the rule of law and I believe she will serve Wyoming and the people of America well. https://t.co/M4vi5vs3Y7

I’m hosting my Inventors Conference online TOMORROW. I encourage folks in Wyoming to come learn the ins and outs of building on your ideas. This year it'll be on Zoom so you can participate from home. Register now: https://t.co/D1tFwb8cXb   Hope to virtually see you there!

Now is not the time to force consumers to face higher prices at the gas pump due to unnecessary government regulations. I joined a letter asking @EPAAWheeler to oppose ethanol mandate expansion and to see that these unnecessary impacts are avoided. https://t.co/i5IuzTMyiZ

These federal housing bureaucracies have grown so large that they are now failing those they should be serving. Read my op-ed on @BudgetGOP's report on how Congress can move forward and provide more effective housing assistance. https://t.co/e02tx4X8lJ

Our housing assistance programs should be streamlined under one roof so the millions of Americans who need these services can find & actually use them. The federal govt's 160 housing assistance programs are scattered across 20 different agencies. Congress can and must do better.
I hope we can get to work to provide the assistance needed to weather this pandemic before our constituents and the economy suffer even more. https://t.co/OEGofGNaKb

It’s disappointing that the Senate cannot come together and move forward on ideas that I think both sides support. The American people are looking to us for help and all we are delivering is stagnation.

Today I voted for another COVID-19 relief package that ultimately failed to pass the Senate. This package would have provided real relief for folks across the country like providing more funding for the Paycheck Protection Program and supporting childcare providers.
She is a remarkable judge and legal scholar with impressive credentials and I look forward to supporting her nomination. https://t.co/Va4iVtXnRE

After meeting with Judge Barrett today I am confident that she is well qualified to be a member of the Supreme Court. We had a great conversation that included issues important to Wyoming. https://t.co/r240rws7ku

Do you have an idea that you want to turn into a business? This year’s Inventors Conference is online and more accessible than ever - join us right from your living room! From business planning to patents we’ll cover it all. Visit my website to register: https://t.co/ybz5z6L2T0

Calling all Wyoming small business owners inventors and entrepreneurs! This year I am hosting my annual Inventors Conference virtually. This is a great opportunity to learn more about the business process. I encourage anyone interested to register today. https://t.co/zNyFpw5I7I https://t.co/AXGiW7NDmh
Diana and I send our well wishes and prayers to President Trump and First Lady Melania Trump for a speedy recovery. https://t.co/l2EI0JjNOK

October is National Retirement Security Month. I encourage folks to dedicate time to their financial planning. This year has been a stark reminder that life can be full of unforeseen challenges – but there are resources waiting to help you plan for a better future. https://t.co/0X0RVyzs7Y

I joined @RepLizCheney and @SenJohnBarrasso in strongly urging the BLM to finalize and adopt clarifications to ensure the plan will be implementable and durable for our state’s future. https://t.co/ufdR1gsQq8
Earlier this year the Bureau of Land Management released a potential plan for the Converse County Oil and Gas Project which would bring important jobs and revenue to Wyoming.

Bob dedicated 44 years of his life to the post office including 18 years as postmaster. I was joined in introducing this bill and remembering him today by Senator Barrasso his son-in-law and Senator Carper. https://t.co/eZFS0bJB6C

Wyoming and Thermopolis lost a core member of the community this month Bob Brown. I can think of no better way to honor someone with such a long and storied career with the U.S. Postal Service than this bill to name the Thermopolis post office after him. https://t.co/cYRoFxdRH3
Do debt and deficit matter? Let’s ask @USCBO. https://t.co/2MxidHln1r

The @USCBO’s updated budget projections confirmed what we all knew – that the economic disruption caused by COVID-19 and the federal government’s response have led to a surge in deficits and debt. https://t.co/ZhaMEuxsNt https://t.co/U7tiC9Fs1m
Now that the House has passed the bipartisan Safeguarding Therapeutics Act it’s time for the Senate to do the same to help protect patients from counterfeit medical products. https://t.co/DgV3inw1Px
Some of the vaccines in the Phase III testing would need to be stored at extremely cold temperature and it’s important that rural states are not left out when it comes to sufficient storage.
Today I asked the @CDCgov director at a health committee hearing how the agency will help plan and prepare rural states for the distribution of a vaccine. https://t.co/442i2R5mHM
Wyoming is proud of our @wyoguard men and women who lead by example and are there to help when called upon. https://t.co/YV9C9QGapz

Happy birthday @usairforce! Wyoming is proud to be home to F.E. Warren Air Force Base and the strong military community that comes with it. From Wyoming to around the globe thank you to our men and women who are serving our nation. https://t.co/Ha4Hvdk1lj
Happy Constitution Day! Our Founding Fathers signed this important document 233 years ago today. It has remained at the heart of our country and unites us as Americans. https://t.co/xQX96rebX7

September is National Workforce Development Month. I’m proud to join a bipartisan resolution to recognize job training centers that prepare our next generation of skilled professionals. From health care to heavy machinery these industries keep the wheels of our country moving. https://t.co/6AbLYaNvPW

I’m disappointed in the EPA’s denial of small refinery waivers. The RFS program is in many ways a broken system and exemptions are necessary for small refineries to compete. This decision could hurt many energy workers in Wyoming and across the country. https://t.co/uKC3RVL7sr

This will be the last year I have the honor of nominating outstanding Wyoming students to our military service academies. The academies offer a quality education and unique set of skills. Learn more about the process and the virtual informational session: https://t.co/20KCO5IVHT

Carbon capture technologies should remain a priority. I joined a bipartisan group calling for the inclusion of the USE IT Act in this year’s national defense spending bill to ensure we invest in innovative technology and keep our energy industries strong. https://t.co/LJ59Ak0wKa
Today we remember the tragedy our country endured on September 11 2001. May we forever honor the innocent lives we lost that day and the bravery of the first responders. https://t.co/TbweOmokkL
I was glad to hear the surgeon general talk about steps the federal government is taking to ensure that a possible COVID-19 vaccine would be safe for children. Learn more: https://t.co/9pFxJ6GcRp

There are unique challenges in pediatric vaccine research because of the safety and ethical concerns about enrolling kids in trials. There can also be differences in how their maturing immune systems work compared to adults. https://t.co/Rp9cQj7i8h

Today I urged the Environment and Public Works Committee to pass my Grizzly Bear State Management Act so these bears can be effectively managed and protected by the efforts of states like Wyoming. Learn more: https://t.co/xiZb7w4sig

Wildlife experts and federal officials agree that the grizzly bears in Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem have been fully recovered for years. As the grizzly bear population has increased in Wyoming so has the danger these animals pose to livestock property and humans. https://t.co/YhVJWKUZuP

Sunday marked the final stop for the Louisa Swain convoy at the 150th anniversary reenactment of Louisa Swain’s 1st vote. Diana and I were glad to spend a beautiful day in Laramie and Cheyenne before the snow storm to see this impressive truck and say thank you to the drivers. https://t.co/EX941ajjUQ

In 1870 Louisa Swain cast her ballot in Laramie - becoming the world’s 1st woman to vote under laws recognizing women’s inherent right to vote. Today we celebrate 150 years of Swain’s historic vote and all the women in Wyoming who continue to shape our great state. https://t.co/qer2qTU0Wi
Investments made to advance new coal technologies allows for more affordable energy options for Americans – and allows Wyoming to continue being a leader in fueling the nation.
I applaud the @EPA for granting Wyoming’s request to manage wells that can be used for carbon capture utilization and sequestration projects. https://t.co/3Uvqew53D6

The @LouisaSwain6 convoy will be in Cheyenne and Laramie later this week to commemorate one of our own trailblazing Wyoming women. The big rig is led by four female drivers who all have driven more than 7.6 million miles combined. https://t.co/9eAigV0NUu

Soda ash is Wyoming’s top export. I applaud the @BLMNational’s final rule to streamline regulations to help our producers remain competitive while making our country less reliant on countries like China for these essential minerals. https://t.co/jjJRGk20yw

I’m glad to hear Taiwan is lifting restrictions that limited U.S. beef & pork imports. This is good news for Wyoming ranchers. It will increase the number of products we can send to Taiwan improving our trade relationship. https://t.co/gYKtsr2AzC
Thank you to First Lady Jennie Gordon and the University of Wyoming for their work to bring this visual together and thank you to Elizabeth Dillow for capturing this historic moment.

Across the nation buildings shined purple and gold for the women's suffrage #ForwardIntoLight slogan. Wyoming participated with an excellent symbol – our woman rider at the “Breakin’ Through” statue in Laramie the 1st place to recognize women’s right to vote. #19amendment https://t.co/OTPW79UtrI

Wyoming is a patchwork of federal state and private land owners and too often the boundaries between them creates unnecessary roadblocks to proper management. This agreement will help allow Wyo and the federal gov to work together to get ahead of the issues facing our forests. https://t.co/0ErWE0Akkw

Women’s Equality Day is around the corner and it’s great to see a Wyoming student featured in @FLOTUS Women’s Vote Centennial project. Congrats to 11-year-old Dakaeyla from Bar Nunn who highlighted Nellie Tayloe Ross first woman to be governor in the US! https://t.co/6XHfSuOK6O https://t.co/G05btNC2QQ
DeJoy has been in this post for only two months and I look forward to seeing what changes he will make to help improve the operations of the postal service. https://t.co/LGpSSVBZD5

While I’m concerned about recent issues with the postal service like delayed deliveries Postmaster General DeJoy explained that many issues are a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. I didn’t realize that and I think a lot of others may not have realized it.
I really appreciate U.S. Postal Service workers in Wyoming particularly. They’re doing an outstanding job in spite of all of the difficulties of the pandemic. https://t.co/mFmSARD7fj
@SenJohnBarrasso @RepLizCheney and I are asking @USDA to quickly investigate this acquisition for potential anti-competitive practices. https://t.co/28lZs8RDxn

I’m concerned about the recent acquisition of a lamb processing plant that could leave thousands of lamb producers in Wyoming and the region with a surplus of lambs that cannot be processed at suitable facilities.

It’s more important than ever that Wyoming and the federal government work together with our universities and the private sector to invest in technology innovation in order to create a more sustainable future – particularly for coal but for all energy. https://t.co/6AMJb7ro1E
I was pleased to participate in a hearing in Gillette today led by @SenJohnBarrasso that focused on advancing carbon capture technology and innovation. https://t.co/vQ4SQKVDl5
If she was in Wyoming this would not have been illegal. https://t.co/Y9ALMJgLeA

Wyoming is home to one-of-a-kind beauty and natural treasures. It’s important to ensure that our public lands and recreational areas are accessible to the public for multiple use so those unique areas can be enjoyed by more people.
The announcement to expand hunting and fishing opportunities on public lands is good news for sportsmen and for our state. https://t.co/VN99blcyeH

Today marks the 100th anniversary of the 19th amendment ratification which granted women’s suffrage in every state. Wyoming is proud to be the first to give women the right to vote – 50 years before the nation! https://t.co/IuCZU5Dx21
Diana and I had a great time at the 108th annual Wyoming State Fair parade in Douglas on Saturday – I even had the honor of being the grand marshal! https://t.co/alWbKG4kHn

Oil and gas companies are facing unprecedented challenges with the COVID-19 pandemic and the economic slowdown. Rescinding these unnecessary and burdensome requirements will help small & mid-sized producers stay afloat and protect jobs in our communities. https://t.co/DjnhgxTAY4
I’m glad the Trump administration is rolling back these costly regulatory burdens. https://t.co/Bb28tc4WAZ

I spent Friday morning in Sheridan honoring Senator Malcolm Wallop and his service to our public lands by visiting the new Malcolm Wallop Park. This park will be a beautiful addition to the city and a great place to celebrate Senator Wallop and connect with the outdoors. https://t.co/zaoQRhTO9i

Many ranchers in Wyoming depend on livestock sales to survive but are left empty-handed if a dealer defaults on a sale. I cosponsored a bipartisan bill that would provide commonsense protections for livestock producers and stability for the overall market. https://t.co/DOnYWdpxdL

The Paycheck Protection Small Business Forgiveness Act would help 4.2 million small business owners focus on what’s important – using their time and energy to keep their businesses afloat. Learn more: https://t.co/LK9E1Fe0vN https://t.co/1Da3ppQpac

The change from the Morgan silver dollar to the Peace silver dollar in 1921 represents a momentous time in our history – the end of WWI. I introduced legislation with @SenCortezMasto that would celebrate the 100th anniversary of the change in design. https://t.co/35g0YqUnm0

National Day of the American Cowboy is a way to say thanks to our cowboys and the work they still do today. The cowboy embodies honesty and integrity and it transcends ethnicity gender and political affiliations. Let’s celebrate all our cowboys out there today. https://t.co/LmQ0lUrniz

It's vital that we are not reliant on foreign nations for key resources such as rare earth. We must support the development of these strategic resources at home in places that have them in abundance – just like Wyoming. https://t.co/XjDbXdJgXn

I’m glad the Senate passed the National Defense Authorization Act today that prioritizes quality of life for our troops while also supporting our American energy industries modernizing technologies and improving the transparency of the Pentagon. https://t.co/1PFjNJmPWk

That’s why I introduced legislation with @SenJohnThune that would close a loophole to help prevent fraud in the program and ensure taxpayer dollars are being spent as intended. https://t.co/uCEsKe4zPJ
The COVID-19 pandemic caused unprecedented unemployment and while it’s important to help those struggling we need to make sure that unemployment money is going to those who are eligible.
I was glad to hear that Michael Nemelka nominee to be a deputy U.S. trade representative takes this issue seriously and will work to reduce our dependence on China. https://t.co/1ongVQnx7A

Wyoming has some of the highest-grade rare earth deposits in North America but not a single operating mine even though they're critical to our national security and economy. The problem is China has a stranglehold on the supply chain making it difficult to utilize deposits here. https://t.co/7EyGl3SIl1
It would allow small businesses to focus on what's important using their time and energy to keep their businesses afloat. https://t.co/jjbGTib6G6

The COVID-19 pandemic has hit small businesses especially hard. I cosponsored bipartisan legislation led by @SenKevinCramer that would simplify and streamline the forgiveness process for Paycheck Protection Program loans under $150000.
Happy birthday @senjohnbarrasso! I’m lucky to call you both my colleague and friend. https://t.co/VXyHPxDdr4

I introduced legislation with @SenatorHassan that would allow the FDA to destroy counterfeit medical products that could be dangerous to patients while strengthening our health care supply chain at a time when we need it most. https://t.co/R5V9Bg3u77
As we continue to combat the coronavirus pandemic it’s critical to ensure that vaccines COVID-19 tests and other medical products are safe and reliable.

In honor of Wyoming’s 130 birthday the @librarycongress put together a collection of state maps pictures resources for teachers veteran stories and more. Celebrate by taking a look at our state’s history! https://t.co/O6Ca8kfhTL
Happy birthday Wyoming! Today we celebrate 130 years of beautiful wild wide-open spaces and great people. There’s nothing quite like our incredible cowboy state. https://t.co/TMQSSuS40z

Wasting taxpayer dollars is unacceptable and our nation’s spending crisis makes it even more important to reduce needless and duplicative government programs. That’s why I cosponsored legislation that would increase government efficiency. https://t.co/tyWWufUQ5k
I spent the 4th of July weekend in Gillette and it was a real blast - the best fireworks of the day! https://t.co/eUMejhbbSr
Happy Independence Day! Diana and I wish everyone in Wyoming and around the country a happy and safe July 4th celebration this weekend. https://t.co/d0VlrHvDJw

I joined @SenatorBraun in introducing legislation to cement the Trump Administration’s no-nonsense rules which require hospitals and insurers to reveal their low discounted cash prices and negotiated rates to consumers before they receive medical care. https://t.co/ny1fBxz2oQ

Americans often leave their health care visits frustrated not knowing what price to expect on the bill. But for many procedures if you can know the cost beforehand you can choose the hospital that fits your needs.

Thanks to Tyler Sasse owner/instructor of the Western @AcademyWelding for giving me a tour of their facilities in Gillette. I appreciate his goal to train young workers in an important field and get manufacturing businesses to invest in the community. https://t.co/pwrJ8HFYd2

The best ideas are the ones that keep in mind what actually works instead of harmful policies that restrict the ability of folks to take action. We should unleash their productivity and empower their personal responsibility to improve our country.

Our government and laws should be focused on actually helping hardworking families not just creating an overcomplicated bureaucracy. I applaud @CommonGood for their efforts to restore the freedom of officials and citizens to use common sense. https://t.co/wUdMiyDC8R
This is especially important as America faces more than $26 trillion in debt and continues dealing with the COVID-19 virus. https://t.co/B02JLKu8bU
During a hearing today on a nominee for the White House Office of Management and Budget we discussed the agency’s work and how crucial it is to know where taxpayer money goes. https://t.co/jnDsafVH5u

I joined a bipartisan letter urging relief for the meat processing industry so we can avoid situations like this in the future and take action to promote a diversified food supply chain. https://t.co/nQBk0RH6sP

COVID-19 outbreaks among employees caused meat processing facilities to slow down production leaving ranchers with excessive livestock and consumers with either empty grocery shelves or overpriced products.

I joined @SenatorHassan in introducing a bill that would save taxpayer dollars by allowing the mint to change the composition of coins to the most cost-effective standard. We should look to increase efficiencies where possible which is what this would do. https://t.co/JYWsjMTGba

The Abandoned Mine Land program has provided crucial funding for states like Wyoming. By reauthorizing the AML fee and making improvements to the program we can help provide much needed relief for coal producers while reclaiming hazardous mine sites. https://t.co/SaK9sUZuh2

Wyoming is proud to be the first to grant women the right to vote – years before the rest of the country. I encourage Wyoming 3rd-12th grade students to submit artwork for this project. https://t.co/6XHfSux9fg https://t.co/EgsZ4TuazC

We should address our national parks backlog responsibly & permanently without adding to our debt. Unfortunately the Great American Outdoors Act represents a one-time fix that is neither. If we won’t pay for even a part of this bill what will we pay for? https://t.co/hP35bhPRWD https://t.co/EZktcBLWxr

Many of our industries have been hit hard by COVID-19 including oil and gas. In Wyoming the rig count dropped from 21 in early March to just one today. I joined a delegation letter urging the administration to extend some deadlines to help support Wyoming producers. https://t.co/VzsVQXYta7

It’s concerning that Wyoming’s unemployment system was targeted by a foreign fraud ring. I was glad to hear from Secretary of Labor Scalia that the department is working to address this serious issue. Learn more: https://t.co/8e9MDFlFDe https://t.co/cpkbz1OW1I

I have the honor of selecting a high school junior to work in Congress as part of the fall Senate Page Program - which gives students a front row seat to see history in the making. I encourage those interested to apply by July 8. Learn how to apply here: https://t.co/4paJtbEN0y

I sent a letter to the Health and Human Services secretary asking what steps are being taken so our country is prepared – especially given the possibility of a second wave of coronavirus infections this fall. https://t.co/tiPrPBzQSd
It's critical to ensure that our national stockpile of health care supplies like personal protective equipment meets the nationwide demand.

I’ve introduced an amendment that is both of those things. Fixing this bill will help ensure we no longer have to put our parks’ current obligations on the backs of future generations.   Learn more: https://t.co/nvffbeyVYL   Watch here: https://t.co/7iY3rs5wqS

Soon the Senate will be debating the Great American Outdoors Act which aims to address the maintenance backlog in our national parks. However this legislation represents a one-time fix that is neither responsible nor permanent.
Our national parks are an important source of pride for our country. Unfortunately they’re in desperate need of repair and maintenance and fixing them will require billions of dollars.

Beef is an important industry for Wyoming which is why I asked the @TheJusticeDept to investigate anticompetitive practices from big processing companies with a group of bipartisan senators. I’m glad the DOJ is now investigating & taking this seriously. https://t.co/ZpbkBwlbib
One morning seventy-six years ago American forces and allied troops stormed Europe to fight for freedoms and put an end to World War 2. https://t.co/uUN2RmaaCQ
Failure to address our unsustainable budget will mean future Congresses won’t have the same flexibility to deal with threats. More here: https://t.co/GuyWNxTKFn

The unprecedented COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted the need for better federal budgeting. We had the financial tools to address the crisis this time but we shouldn’t assume this will always be true. https://t.co/9ACA1pYch8

For too long the Clean Water Act has been abused and used to delay important energy infrastructure projects. @EPA's important change to the act is good news for Wyoming and will help support jobs in our state at a time when certainty is much needed. https://t.co/0jXA2RqZeM
Happy graduation to all the Wyoming high school graduates! Graduating is an important and impressive accomplishment pandemic or not. I am so proud of you class of 2020! https://t.co/4PzGydlLNG
These plans will help give our state flexibility to offer students different training and education opportunities needed to succeed in the modern workforce. https://t.co/5kJK93avkM

I’m glad the Education Department approved Wyoming’s career and technical education plans. I was proud to lead the reauthorization of the Perkins Career and Technical Education Act in 2018 that helped make this possible.

I’ve long been a proponent of allowing the Wyo governor’s office to work with BLM and our stakeholders to implement plans that work for all. This decision fails to properly acknowledge all the hard work to protect the species by those on the ground who know what works best.
I’m disappointed in a federal judge’s decision to side with environmental activists and invalidate oil and gas leases. https://t.co/0rO2AYa7Yh

While our lives have changed in the last couple months our duty to honor fallen service members has not. We are forever indebted to the brave men and women who paid the ultimate sacrifice. They are my heroes. #MemorialDay https://t.co/i6zaeTCGCt

Wyoming leads in uranium production and the Russian efforts to dominate U.S. markets pose serious threats. I joined a bipartisan group of senators in asking the Commerce Department to reduce our country’s dependence on Russian uranium imports. https://t.co/dPEMZdTORL
Between the drop in fuel demand and the tripling costs of complying with the Renewable Fuel Standard there is no better time than now to provide relief to our refiners.
I joined a letter calling on @EPAAWheeler to waive burdensome regulations on our country’s refineries. https://t.co/LZr3LNgTK9

Not everyone is able to do their job from home. Many workers are on the frontlines every day to provide us with the goods and services we need. Their work is not unnoticed and I thank them for their dedication.
Even across the nation there are large businesses setting examples like car insurance companies giving back money voluntarily. https://t.co/yzrqfxrRZK

In the middle of this pandemic it’s heartwarming to see stories of businesses giving back to their communities. From making hand sanitizer to making mobile hospital rooms Wyoming is full of generosity. See a few of these stories here: https://t.co/1bIPGKfWw4

Easing regulatory requirements like paperwork and other red tape is an important step in addressing the impact of COVID-19 on businesses. I signed a letter urging Senate leadership to consider commonsense regulatory relief for businesses small and large. https://t.co/gsmG47asxX

Police officers dedicate their lives so our communities are safe. I was proud to cosponsor the Senate resolution declaring this National Police Week. I send my sincere thank you to Wyoming police sheriffs rangers corrections officers game wardens and highway patrol. https://t.co/cr5tyIgXAb

Congress has heard growing concerns from producers about the intensifying problems in our cattle industries like price manipulation. I joined a letter with @SenatorFischer & @SenJohnBarrasso calling on @TheJusticeDept to investigate these serious claims. https://t.co/MznFV9EGcw
I was glad to hear at a Senate health care committee hearing today that the government is working to ensure we are ready for these challenges. More here: https://t.co/FeeJ6fBQdI

We also need to be sure we’re prepared for a second wave of outbreaks that could coincide with the start of the flu season potentially stressing our health care system more than it already has been. This includes being fully prepared for a possible vaccine.
Preparation is key when it comes to combating COVID-19. We’re fighting this virus at the same time scientists are learning about it so we need to be nimble. https://t.co/DfX5gKUo6m

The Stafford Act only allows for the federal government to provide state and local governments with disaster relief and emergency assistance. President Trump invoked the Stafford Act when he declared a national emergency in response to COVID-19.
Social media posts text messages and voicemails have been circulating claiming that the president will invoke the Stafford Act to order a mandatory two-week quarantine.

HOAX ALERT: If you’ve been misled and panicked by rumors about military action and the Stafford Act just google Stafford Act to see that it is a huge hoax. With new updates about COVID-19 coming every day it’s important to stay alert for misleading information.
Diana and I are sending our gratitude to truck drivers. Next time you see a trucker thank her or him.

Truckers are an important link keeping hospitals grocery stores and everything in between supplied in spite of the virus. They are moms and dads husbands and wives. They are some of the hardest working patriotic people in the country moving virtually all of the goods.

There are a lot of folks across the country working hard to ensure we have the essential resources or services we need during this challenging time. Truck drivers are one of them and they don’t get much attention. When they do it’s often underappreciated.
